section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|Contents|1 Cloud Reporting 1
indexed_text: Overview of Oracle Accounting Hub Reporting Cloud Service for E-Business Suite Customers ................................... 1
section_synopsis: Reporting and 1
indexed_synopsis: Oracle's Accounting Hub Reporting Cloud Service is designed specifically for E-Business Suite customers, providing a centralized platform to manage and report financial data. The service streamlines reporting processes, offering real-time insights and enhanced visibility into organizational finances. With this solution, users can simplify financial planning and analysis, making it easier to drive business decisions.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|Contents|2 Other Financial Reporting 3
section_synopsis:
Here is the summarized title:

Other Financial Reporting 3
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense, 2-3 sentence summary:

The financial reporting center provides an overview of key financial metrics. Setup involves establishing the center and smart view to facilitate data analysis. Predefined reports in Oracle General Ledger offer a starting point for in-depth financial insights.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|Get Help
indexed_text: There are a number of ways to learn more about your product and interact with Oracle and other users.
section_synopsis: Get Help
indexed_synopsis: Discover ways to engage with Oracle and other users, expanding knowledge about your product through various methods.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|Get Help|Get Help in the Applications
indexed_text:
Some application pages have help icons
to give you access to contextual help. If you don't see any help icons on your page, click your user image or name in the global header and select Show Help Icons. If the page has contextual help, help icons will appear.
section_synopsis: Get assistance with applications.
indexed_synopsis: Application pages offer contextual help through icons; if none are visible, users can enable them by showing help icons from their profile dropdown menu.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|Get Help|Get Support
indexed_text: You can get support at My Oracle Support . For accessible support, visit Oracle Accessibility Learning and Support .
section_synopsis: Get support and assistance.
indexed_synopsis: Oracle offers support through My Oracle Support, with additional accessibility resources available at the Oracle Accessibility site for customers requiring specialized assistance.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|Get Help|Get Training
indexed_text: Increase your knowledge of Oracle Cloud by taking courses at Oracle University .
section_synopsis:
Here is the summary:

Training available
indexed_synopsis: Boost your understanding of Oracle Cloud through educational courses at Oracle University, enhancing your skills and expertise in the process.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|Get Help|Join Our Community
indexed_text: Use Cloud Customer Connect to get information from industry experts at Oracle and in the partner community. You can join forums to connect with other customers, post questions, suggest ideas for product enhancements, and watch events.
section_synopsis: Join and connect with others.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense summary of the paragraph:

Oracle's Cloud Customer Connect platform connects users with industry experts, allowing for knowledge sharing and collaboration through forums and discussions. This platform enables users to ask questions, share ideas, and engage in community-driven innovation.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|Get Help|Learn About Accessibility
indexed_text: For information about Oracle's commitment to accessibility, visit the Oracle Accessibility Program . Videos included in this guide are provided as a media alternative for text-based topics also available in this guide.
section_synopsis: Learn about accessibility features and get assistance.
indexed_synopsis: Oracle prioritizes accessibility through its program, providing equal opportunities for all users. This guide offers multimedia alternatives, including videos, for those who prefer non-text content, ensuring inclusivity and comprehension.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|Get Help|Share Your Feedback
indexed_text: We welcome your feedback about Oracle Applications user assistance. If you need clarification, find an error, or just want to tell us what you found helpful, we'd like to hear from you. You can email your feedback to oracle_fusion_applications_help_ww_grp@oracle.com . Thanks for helping us improve our user assistance!
section_synopsis: Seek feedback and share thoughts
indexed_synopsis: Oracle welcomes customer feedback on Applications user assistance, seeking clarification, error corrections, and suggestions for improvement through email at oracle_fusion_applications_help_ww_grp@oracle.com. The goal is to enhance the overall user experience.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|1 Cloud Reporting|Overview of Oracle Accounting Hub Reporting Cloud Service for E-Business Suite Customers
indexed_text: Oracle Accounting Hub Reporting Cloud Service provides E-Business Suite customers exceptional reporting and analytics capabilities with minimal disruption to their current financial management processes. The predefined integration between the Accounting Hub Reporting Cloud Service and E-Business Suite Release 12 (R12) allows E-Business Suite customers to gain real-time access to information and improve business decisions with minimal costs and reduced risk. Customers can continue to use their current financial processes for day-to-day operational accounting, and then use the Accounting Hub Reporting Cloud Service for their reporting and analysis. For more information, see Accounting Hub Reporting Cloud Service for E-Business Suite Customers, DOC ID 2034564.1, on My Oracle Support.
section_synopsis: Reporting overview for E-Business Suite customers.
indexed_synopsis: Oracle's Accounting Hub Reporting Cloud Service offers seamless reporting and analytics capabilities to E-Business Suite customers, streamlining financial management with minimal disruption. This integration enables real-time access to information, enhancing business decision-making at reduced costs and risk. The service allows for continued use of existing processes for day-to-day accounting, reserving the cloud service for reporting and analysis.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center
indexed_text: The Financial Reporting Center is intended to be the primary user interface for financials end users to access all seven report types.
section_synopsis: Overview of Financial Reporting Center
indexed_synopsis: Financial reporting center serves as a central hub, offering users seamless access to various reports, including seven distinct types. This unified platform streamlines financial data retrieval, making it easy for end-users to find and utilize relevant information.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Financial Reporting Center
indexed_text: The Financial Reporting Center includes these report types: Financial Reporting Web Studio Reports, Account Groups and Sunburst, Smart View Reports, Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence Analyses, Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence Dashboards, Oracle Analytics Publisher Reports, and Business Intelligence Mobile Apps. Other reporting tools are also available to run the same seven report types. This figure illustrates the report types that are available in the Financial Reporting Center. Reports can be accessed through various methods. However, the Financial Reporting Center provides access to every type of report, is intended to be the primary user interface for financials end users, and is tablet and smartphone friendly. In addition to accessing reports, you can add favorites, define tags, and view report details, such as type and last updated date.
section_synopsis: Financial Reporting Center provides a centralized platform for managing financial reporting requirements. It offers flexible and scalable solutions for organizations to report their financial performance accurately.
indexed_synopsis:
Here's a dense summary:

The Financial Reporting Center offers various report types, including web-based studio reports, account groupings, and analytics dashboards, accessible through multiple methods. As the primary interface for financial users, it also provides tablet and smartphone compatibility. Users can additionally customize their experience by adding favorites, defining tags, and viewing report details.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Financial Reporting Center
indexed_text: Financial Reports are read from the Shared > Custom > Financials and My Folders directories. All other report types can be saved anywhere in the BI Catalog however, any user-defined content should be in the Shared > Custom folder. Subfolders can be created within the Shared > Custom folder. Seven types of reports can be run from the Financial Reporting Center and from the other reporting tools. Financial Reports: These reports are built off of the Oracle Financial Reporting Web Studio using data in the Oracle General Ledger balances cube. For example, company income statements and balance sheets. These reports are mainly run by users in General Ledger. Account Groups and Sunburst: Account groups are used to monitor key accounts in General Ledger. When a user creates an account group, it becomes visible in the Financial Reporting Center with the Sunburst visualization tool. The Sunburst visualization tool lets you interact with your account balances across various business dimensions to view balances from different perspectives.
section_synopsis: Financial Reporting Center provides a centralized platform for managing financial reporting requirements. It offers flexible and scalable solutions for organizations to report their financial performance accurately.
indexed_synopsis: Financial reports can be accessed through the Shared > Custom > Financials and My Folders directories, while other report types are stored elsewhere in the BI Catalog. Seven types of reports are available, including financial reports built on Oracle General Ledger data, as well as account groups and sunburst visualizations for monitoring key accounts.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Financial Reporting Center
indexed_text: When a user creates an account group, it becomes visible in the Financial Reporting Center with the Sunburst visualization tool. The Sunburst visualization tool lets you interact with your account balances across various business dimensions to view balances from different perspectives. Account groups are used only in General Ledger. Smart View Reports: Smart View is a multidimensional pivot analysis tool combined with full Excel functionality. Smart View enables you to interactively analyze your balances and define reports using a familiar spreadsheet environment. These queries are mainly for users in General Ledger. To share Smart View queries, users can email them to other users, or they can upload the queries to the Financial Reporting Center where users can download them to a local drive for use. The Financial Reporting Center is only a place for users to upload and download Smart View queries.
section_synopsis: Financial Reporting Center provides a centralized platform for managing financial reporting requirements. It offers flexible and scalable solutions for organizations to report their financial performance accurately.
indexed_synopsis: Account groups created in General Ledger are displayed in the Financial Reporting Center with Sunburst visualizations, allowing for multi-dimensional balance views. Smart View Reports enable interactive analysis and report definition within Excel-like environments, primarily used by General Ledger users. Queries can be shared via email or uploaded to the Financial Reporting Center for download.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Financial Reporting Center
indexed_text: To share Smart View queries, users can email them to other users, or they can upload the queries to the Financial Reporting Center where users can download them to a local drive for use. The Financial Reporting Center is only a place for users to upload and download Smart View queries. Note: To upload a Smart View report to the Financial Reporting Center: select the Open Workspace for Financial Reports task, navigate to the BI Catalog, and select Upload from the Tasks section. Be sure to upload the Excel file to one of the folder locations mentioned previously. Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence Analyses: These analyses and reports are built off of transactional tables using subject areas. These reports can be run by users in General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, Cash Management, Intercompany, and so on.
section_synopsis: Financial Reporting Center provides a centralized platform for managing financial reporting requirements. It offers flexible and scalable solutions for organizations to report their financial performance accurately.
indexed_synopsis: Smart View queries can be shared via email or uploaded to the Financial Reporting Center for download. Reports built from transactional tables use subject areas, allowing users to access analyses in various modules such as General Ledger and Payables.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Financial Reporting Center
indexed_text: Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence Analyses: These analyses and reports are built off of transactional tables using subject areas. These reports can be run by users in General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, Cash Management, Intercompany, and so on. Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence Dashboards: Dashboards put all the information, functions, and actions that a business user must have to do their job in one place. Dashboards are built off of Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence objects like analyses and reports. These reports can be run by users in General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, Cash Management, Intercompany, and so on. Oracle Analytics Publisher Reports: Most of these reports are predefined and must first be submitted and resubmitted to see the latest data by the Oracle Enterprise Scheduler through the Scheduled Processes navigation.
section_synopsis: Financial Reporting Center provides a centralized platform for managing financial reporting requirements. It offers flexible and scalable solutions for organizations to report their financial performance accurately.
indexed_synopsis: Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence offers customized analyses and dashboards built from transactional tables and subject areas, providing users with a centralized platform for their job functions. These reports can be run across various modules such as General Ledger and Payables.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Financial Reporting Center
indexed_text: These reports can be run by users in General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, Cash Management, Intercompany, and so on. Oracle Analytics Publisher Reports: Most of these reports are predefined and must first be submitted and resubmitted to see the latest data by the Oracle Enterprise Scheduler through the Scheduled Processes navigation. These reports can be run by users in General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, Cash Management, Intercompany, and so on. BI Mobile Apps: Oracle Business Intelligence Mobile App Designer is an application that enables you to create multitouch information-driven applications with rich interaction, rich visualization, and rich media, for mobile devices such as iPhone, iPad, Android phone, tablet, and more. These reports can be run by users in General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, Cash Management, Intercompany, and so on.
section_synopsis: Financial Reporting Center provides a centralized platform for managing financial reporting requirements. It offers flexible and scalable solutions for organizations to report their financial performance accurately.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense, 2-3 sentence summary:

Oracle Analytics Publisher Reports provide predefined reports that can be run across various modules, including General Ledger and more. These reports require submission to the Oracle Enterprise Scheduler for updates. Additionally, the BI Mobile App Designer enables users to create interactive applications with rich visualization and media for mobile devices.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Other Reporting Tools
indexed_text: Six other tools are available for reporting in Financials. The following table lists the other reporting tools and the types of reports they support.
section_synopsis: Financial reporting center and other reporting tools provide insight into financial data.
indexed_synopsis: Financials offers multiple reporting tools beyond the primary one, including six additional options that cater to diverse report needs. These supplementary tools facilitate customized reporting, allowing users to create tailored documents.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Other Reporting Tools
indexed_text:
Other Reporting Tools Report Type
General Accounting Dashboard and Account Inspector
Account Groups
Reports and Analytics
Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence Objects
BI Catalog
All Report Types, Except Oracle Analytics Publisher Reports
Enterprise Performance Management Workspace
Reports, Books, Snapshot Reports, Snapshot Books, Financial Reporting Batches, and Batch Scheduler
Enterprise Scheduler System
Oracle Analytics Publisher Reports
Even though the Financial Reporting Center is designed to be the main user interface for a financial end user's reporting needs, some users may choose to use any of the six other tools for reporting in financials, such as:
General Accounting Dashboard, which provides access to Account Groups: Uses the Account Monitor to efficiently monitor and track key account balances in real time. Account Inspector: Perform ad hoc queries from account groups and financial reports through drill down to underlying journals and subledger transactions. Reports and Analytics: This reporting tool has a panel that reflects the folder structure of the BI Catalog.
section_synopsis: Financial reporting center and other reporting tools provide insight into financial data.
indexed_synopsis: The Financial Reporting Center serves as a primary interface for end-users, but alternatives exist. The General Accounting Dashboard offers real-time account balance monitoring and ad-hoc querying capabilities, while Reports and Analytics provides a folder-structured panel reflecting the BI Catalog.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Other Reporting Tools
indexed_text: Account Inspector: Perform ad hoc queries from account groups and financial reports through drill down to underlying journals and subledger transactions. Reports and Analytics: This reporting tool has a panel that reflects the folder structure of the BI Catalog. Users can access and run any Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence analysis, report or dashboard. Users can't run predefined Financial Reports or Oracle Analytics Publisher reports from this interface. This interface can be used by all financials users. BI Catalog: A component of the Enterprise Performance Management Workspace where you can run all report types, except for predefined Oracle Analytics Publisher reports. Enterprise Performance Management Workspace: Create reports, books, snapshot reports, snapshot books, Financial Reporting batches, and batch scheduler, and schedule batches to automatically run and burst to email. Enterprise Scheduler System: Only Oracle Analytics Publisher reports can be submitted from this interface. Users access this interface by navigating to Tools > Scheduled Processes .
section_synopsis: Financial reporting center and other reporting tools provide insight into financial data.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense summary of the paragraph:

Account Inspector provides ad hoc queries for financial reports, with drill-down capabilities to underlying transactions. The Reports and Analytics tool offers a BI Catalog panel for running Oracle analyses, reports, and dashboards. The Enterprise Performance Management Workspace enables report creation and scheduling, while the Enterprise Scheduler System handles submission of specific Oracle Analytics Publisher reports.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Overview of Financial Reporting Center|Other Reporting Tools
indexed_text:
Enterprise Scheduler System: Only Oracle Analytics Publisher reports can be submitted from this interface. Users access this interface by navigating to Tools > Scheduled Processes . Most financial users have access to this interface to run standard reports for General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, and so on. Related Topics
Set Up Financial Reporting Center and Smart View
How to Access EPM Narrative Reporting Reports in Financial Reporting Center
section_synopsis: Financial reporting center and other reporting tools provide insight into financial data.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense summary of the paragraph:

The Enterprise Scheduler System enables users to submit Oracle Analytics Publisher reports. Users access this interface from Tools > Scheduled Processes, where they can run standard financial reports for General Ledger, Payables, and Receivables. This interface is accessible to most financial users.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Set Up Financial Reporting Center and Smart View
indexed_text:
The Financial Reporting Center is a powerful tool for reviewing, designing, and presenting financial reports and analytic data. The critical choices required to configure and install the components in Financial Reporting Center consist of:
Configuring the Financial Reporting Center
section_synopsis: Set up financial reporting center and smart view for specific purposes.
indexed_synopsis: Financial Reporting Center helps design, review, and present financial data. Key configuration decisions involve setting up this tool for effective use.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Set Up Financial Reporting Center and Smart View
indexed_text:
Installing Smart View, performed by your end users
Configuring Workspace Database Connection, performed by your administrator
section_synopsis: Set up financial reporting center and smart view for specific purposes.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense summary of the paragraph:

End-users install Smart View, while administrators configure Workspace Database connections to ensure seamless integration.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Set Up Financial Reporting Center and Smart View|Configuring Financial Reporting Center
indexed_text: You have access to the reports in the Financial Reporting Center and Workspace installed with Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials. Your Oracle Fusion Business Intelligence (BI) administrator defines the folder structure in Workspace. The administrator considers your company's security requirements for folders and reports, as well as report distribution requirements for financial reporting batches. Security can be set on folders and reports from Workspace. You are granted access to the folders and reports you want to view by your BI administrator.
section_synopsis: Configure Financial Reporting Center and set up Smart View.
indexed_synopsis: Accessing reports is enabled through Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials' Financial Reporting Center and Workspace, with folder structures defined by administrators considering security and distribution requirements. Workspace allows setting security for folders and reports, granting users access to desired views. Administrators control report accessibility and distribution.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Set Up Financial Reporting Center and Smart View|Installing Smart View
indexed_text:
Smart View is an Excel add-in that must be loaded on each client. To download Smart View, click Navigator > Financial Reporting Center > Tasks panel drawer > Open Workspace for Financial Reports . Once the workspace is started, click Tools > Install > Smart View . Note: Since Smart View is an add-in to Microsoft Office products, you can install Smart View only on a Windows operating system. Once Smart View is installed, you must configure the connection using the Smart View Shared Connections URL. You can derive the Shared Connections URL by following these steps:
1. From the Financial Reporting Center task panel, select Open Workspace for Financial Reporting . 2. Edit the workspace URL by removing index.jsp and adding SmartViewProviders at the end.
section_synopsis: Setup and installation of financial reporting tools.
indexed_synopsis: Smart View is an Excel add-in that requires installation on each client via the Navigator menu. Once installed, it must be configured with a Shared Connections URL, which can be derived by modifying the Financial Reporting Center workspace URL. Installation is limited to Windows operating systems and Microsoft Office products.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Set Up Financial Reporting Center and Smart View|Installing Smart View
indexed_text:

Note: For example, if the workspace URL is https://example.com/workspace/index.jsp , then the shared connections URL would be https://example.com/workspace/SmartViewProviders . 3. Copy the URL. 4. Open Excel. 5. From the Smart View menu, click Options > Advanced . 6. Paste the URL in the Shared Connections URL field. 7. Click OK . To connect Oracle General Ledger balances cubes in Smart View:
1. Open Smart View from your Start menu > Programs > Microsoft Office > Microsoft Excel 2007 . 2. Navigate to the Smart View menu > Open . On the Start on the ribbon, click Smart View Panel that appears in the list of values from the ribbon. The task pane opens. 3.

section_synopsis: Setup and installation of financial reporting tools.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Set Up Financial Reporting Center and Smart View|Configuring Workspace Database Connections
indexed_text:
Administrators must create database connections from Workspace so users can access the cubes from Workspace and Financial Reporting Web Studio. Note: Ledger setup has to be completed before the database connection can be created. General Ledger balances cubes are created as part of ledger setup. A separate cube is created for each combination of chart of accounts and accounting calendar. A database connection is needed for each cube. Steps to define a database connection are:
1. Start at the Navigator by selecting Financial Reporting Center . 2. From the Financial Reporting Center task panel, select Open Workspace for Financial Reporting . 3. From within Workspace select the Navigator menu > Applications > BI Catalog . 4. Select Tools menu > Database Connection Manager . 5. Select New button. 6. Enter a user-friendly name for the Database Connection Name . 7. Enter Essbase as the Type , your server, user name, and password. 8. Select Application (cube) and Database from the list of values.
section_synopsis: Configure workspace database connections for financial reporting.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense summary of the paragraph:

To access cubes from Workspace or Financial Reporting Web Studio, administrators must create database connections. This requires completing ledger setup, which creates general ledger balances cubes based on chart of accounts and accounting calendars. A separate connection is needed for each cube, requiring specification of type, server, user name, and password in the Database Connection Manager.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Set Up Financial Reporting Center and Smart View|Configuring Workspace Database Connections
indexed_text: 8. Select Application (cube) and Database from the list of values. Expand the Application name to see the related Database . 9. Click the OK button twice to save your selections. 10. Click Close button in the Database Connection Manager window to save your connection. Note: The database connection is available in both Workspace and Financial Reporting Web Studio. Optionally, it can be set up in Financial Reporting Web Studio when putting grids on a report. This should only be done by an administrator.
section_synopsis: Configure workspace database connections for financial reporting.
indexed_synopsis: Establishing a database connection involves selecting the application and database, then saving the selections and closing the window. The connection is available in both Workspace and Financial Reporting Web Studio, and can be set up separately in Web Studio for grid reports. An administrator typically handles this setup.

To access Oracle Essbase, select it from shared connections, expand the list of cubes, and then choose your specific cube. For new servers and databases, perform these steps once to set up the connection. Additionally, customize the display name and alias for the Essbase database through Member Options settings.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Oracle General Ledger Predefined Reports
indexed_text:
Oracle General Ledger provides predefined reports that cover the following areas: account analysis, journals, trial balance reports, reconciliation reports, charts of accounts. You can schedule and run reports from the Scheduled Processes work area. In some cases, you can access and open reports in the Reports and Analytics work area. Use the Browse Catalog icon on the Reports and Analytics work area to open the business intelligence (BI) Catalog. You can run and edit reports in the BI Catalog. The following table describes the predefined account analysis reports. Name Description
Account Analysis
Prints balances by account segment and a secondary segment for each journal entry. Lists the subledger document number for transactions imported from subledgers. General Ledger Account Details Report
Provides journal information to trace each transaction back to its original source. Prints a separate page for each balancing segment value. For each journal line, prints:
section_synopsis:
Here is the summarized title:

General Ledger Predefined Reports
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a 2-3 sentence summary:

Oracle General Ledger offers predefined reports covering account analysis, journals, and more. Users can schedule and run reports from the Scheduled Processes area or access them in the Reports and Analytics area. The platform provides detailed information on transactions and balances by account segment, allowing for easy tracing and analysis.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Oracle General Ledger Predefined Reports|The account affected, the concatenated description, the journal line amount, and the beginning and ending account balance. Journal details including source, category, journal name, and effective date.
indexed_text:
Lists accounts in ascending order by account segment value. Prints a CR next to credit amounts. Account Analysis for Contra Account Report
Prints balances by account segment and a secondary segment. Lists the contra account for each journal entry and the subledger document number for transactions imported from subledgers. Prints by date range, accounting flexfield range, contra account, and amount range. Average Balance Audit Account Analysis Report
Displays the detail account activity that created the aggregate balances and related average balances. Displays daily average balance information for the selected accounts for the specified range of dates. Contains parameters such as the as-of reporting date, average balance type (period, quarter, or year average-to-date), and account ranges. Note: Use to research how average balances are calculated for an account.
section_synopsis:
Here is a compact summary of the section title:

Account and financial data summarized by report. Includes detailed journal information.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense 2-3 sentence summary:

The report provides detailed analysis of contra accounts by segment value, including credit amounts denoted by CR. It also displays average balance information with parameters such as reporting date, balance type, and account ranges. This tool helps research how average balances are calculated for an account.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Set Up Financial Reporting Center and Smart View|Configuring Workspace Database Connections
indexed_text: For more detailed information about Smart View and Financial Reporting Web Studio, refer to the Using EPM with Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials link on the Oracle Financials All Books page of the Oracle Help Center at https:// docs.oracle.com.
section_synopsis: Configure workspace database connections for financial reporting.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense summary of the paragraph:

Oracle provides additional information on Smart View and Financial Reporting Web Studio through the Using EPM with Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials guide, accessible via the Oracle Help Center. This resource offers in-depth details for users seeking to learn more about these tools.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Oracle General Ledger Predefined Reports|The account affected, the concatenated description, the journal line amount, and the beginning and ending account balance. Journal details including source, category, journal name, and effective date.
indexed_text:
The following table describes the predefined journal reports. Name Description
Journals Report
Provides journal activity for a given period or range of periods, balancing segment value, currency, and range of account segment values. Prints the accounting date, category, journal name, reference, journal batch name, entered debit or credit amounts, net balance, and account total for each journal. Includes a total for each balancing segment and a grand total for all the activity. General Journals Report
Provides journal activity for a given period or range of periods, balancing segment value, currency, and range of account segment values. Journals Batch Summary Report
Lists posted journal batches for a particular ledger, balancing segment value, currency, and date range. Provides information about actual balances for your journal batches, source, batch, and posting dates, total entered debits and credits. Sorts the information by journal batch within each journal entry category.
section_synopsis:
Here is a compact summary of the section title:

Account and financial data summarized by report. Includes detailed journal information.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a 2-3 sentence summary of the paragraph:

Journal reports provide detailed activity summaries for specific periods or ranges, including balancing segment values, currency, and account totals. Reports include information such as accounting dates, debit/credit amounts, and net balances. Additionally, batch summaries list posted journal batches with actual balances and sorting options by category.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Oracle General Ledger Predefined Reports|The account affected, the concatenated description, the journal line amount, and the beginning and ending account balance. Journal details including source, category, journal name, and effective date.
indexed_text:
Provides information about actual balances for your journal batches, source, batch, and posting dates, total entered debits and credits. Sorts the information by journal batch within each journal entry category. Includes totals for each journal category and a grand total for each ledger and balancing segment value combination. Doesn't report on budget or encumbrance balances. Journals Details Report
Provides information about manually entered journals prior to posting, including field by field, all data entered into the applications or data imported from external sources. Journals Day Book Report
Provides posted journal entries and journal details chronologically by accounting date for a specified range of dates, journal source, and journal category. Note: To run the report for all journal sources and categories, clear the Source and Category fields. Sorts journal entries for each accounting date by document number. Prints the accounting date, document number, journal entry name, journal source and category, subledger document name and number, currency, and conversion rate.
section_synopsis:
Here is a compact summary of the section title:

Account and financial data summarized by report. Includes detailed journal information.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense summary of the paragraph:

The reports provide detailed information on journals, including actual balances, posting dates, and totals for each ledger and segment. The Journals Details Report shows manual entries prior to posting, while the Journals Day Book Report lists posted journal entries chronologically by accounting date.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Oracle General Ledger Predefined Reports|The account affected, the concatenated description, the journal line amount, and the beginning and ending account balance. Journal details including source, category, journal name, and effective date.
indexed_text: Sorts journal entries for each accounting date by document number. Prints the accounting date, document number, journal entry name, journal source and category, subledger document name and number, currency, and conversion rate. Note: When you set the General Ledger Journal Entry Summarization option, as part of the Manage Subledger Accounting Options task, to either Summarize by general ledger date or Summarize by general ledger period , the SUBLEDGER_DOC_SEQUENCE_ID and SUBLEDGER_DOC_SEQUENCE_ VALUE columns will be empty in the GL_JE_LINES table, even though document sequencing is enabled. All subledger entry lines are summarized into a single general ledger entry if the following details are the same: accounting period or date, General Ledger journal category, account, entered currency, side, balance type. As a result, the report won't display details in the Subledger Document Sequence and Subledger Document Number columns.
section_synopsis:
Here is a compact summary of the section title:

Account and financial data summarized by report. Includes detailed journal information.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense summary of the paragraph:

Journal entries are sorted by document number, displaying key information such as accounting date, journal name, and category. When summarizing by general ledger date or period, subledger document sequence IDs will be empty in the GL_JE_LINES table. Summarized entries combine similar details, omitting Subledger Document Sequence and Number columns.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Oracle General Ledger Predefined Reports|The account affected, the concatenated description, the journal line amount, and the beginning and ending account balance. Journal details including source, category, journal name, and effective date.
indexed_text:
All subledger entry lines are summarized into a single general ledger entry if the following details are the same: accounting period or date, General Ledger journal category, account, entered currency, side, balance type. As a result, the report won't display details in the Subledger Document Sequence and Subledger Document Number columns. Prints for each journal line, the line number, account segment value and description, functional debit and credit amounts, description, and cost center segment value. Reconciled Transactions Report
Provides details of clearing account journal lines that have been successfully reconciled by both automatic and manual reconciliation processes.

Here is a compact summary of the section title:

Account and financial data summarized by report. Includes detailed journal information.
indexed_synopsis: Subledger entry lines with identical accounting period/date, GL journal category, account, currency, side, and balance type are consolidated into a single general ledger entry. The report displays line number, account segment value, and functional debit/credit amounts. It also provides details of reconciled transactions, including clearing accounts successfully cleared by both automatic and manual processes.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Oracle General Ledger Predefined Reports|The account affected, the concatenated description, the journal line amount, and the beginning and ending account balance. Journal details including source, category, journal name, and effective date.
indexed_text:
Name Description
Unreconciled Transactions Report
Lists all unreconciled clearing account journal lines, specifically the unreconciled lines that weren't subjected to reconciliation yet, those lines rejected by previous automatic or manual reconciliation processes, and those lines that were marked as reviewed. Journal and Transaction Details Report
Lists the general ledger journals and subledger transactions activity along with header, line, and distribution-level details. Includes the account combinations on each line for the selected accounts. Note: You can run or schedule this report only from Oracle Analytics Publisher. The following table describes the predefined trial balance reports. Name Description
Trial Balance Report
Provides summarized actual account balances and activity by ledger, balancing segment, and account segment value. Trial Balance - Average Balances
Provides a listing of ending balances and average balances for selected accounts based on an effective date specified. Prints the ledger currency or foreign-entered balances.
section_synopsis:
Here is a compact summary of the section title:

Account and financial data summarized by report. Includes detailed journal information.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense 2-3 sentence summary:

The Unreconciled Transactions Report and Journal and Transaction Details Report provide insights into financial activity, with the former listing unreconciled clearing account journal lines and the latter offering detailed information on general ledger journals and subledger transactions. The Trial Balance Report and Trial Balance - Average Balances report focus on summarized account balances and average balances by various segment values, providing a comprehensive view of financial performance.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Oracle General Ledger Predefined Reports|The account affected, the concatenated description, the journal line amount, and the beginning and ending account balance. Journal details including source, category, journal name, and effective date.
indexed_text:
Trial Balance - Average Balances
Provides a listing of ending balances and average balances for selected accounts based on an effective date specified. Prints the ledger currency or foreign-entered balances. Displays period, quarter, and year average-to-date balances. Note: Request additional information by specifying balancing segments and account ranges. The following table describes the predefined reconciliation reports. Name Description
Cash to General Ledger Reconciliation Report
Extracts cash management and general ledger accounting and transactional data for reconciling cash management to the general ledger. Payables to Ledger Reconciliation Report
Provides both summarized and detailed reconciling data for review. Shows payables and accounting beginning and ending balances, as well as summarized activity for the period and how this activity was accounted. Receivables to Ledger Reconciliation Report
Provides reconciliation of receivables data to the general ledger.

The Trial Balance report offers average balance summaries by period, quarter, or year, displaying currency-specific balances for selected accounts. It also provides predefined reconciliation reports for cash management, payables, and receivables, offering both summarized and detailed data for review.

Shows payables and accounting beginning and ending balances, as well as summarized activity for the period and how this activity was accounted. Receivables to Ledger Reconciliation Report
Provides reconciliation of receivables data to the general ledger. Shows receivables and accounting beginning and ending balances, as well as summarized activity for the period and how the activity was accounted. The following table describes the predefined chart of account reports.

indexed_synopsis: The report shows payables and accounting balances at the start and end of a period, along with summarized transactions and their corresponding accounting treatment. Additionally, it provides a reconciliation of receivables data to the general ledger, highlighting any discrepancies or adjustments made during the period.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|2 Other Financial Reporting|Oracle General Ledger Predefined Reports|The account affected, the concatenated description, the journal line amount, and the beginning and ending account balance. Journal details including source, category, journal name, and effective date.
indexed_text:
Name Description
Balancing Segment Value Assignments Report
Reports on the assignment of primary balancing segment values to legal entities and ledgers across accounting setups. Allows quick identification of overlapping balancing segment value errors and reviews of any unassigned values. Note: The application doesn't check for overlapping balancing segment values online. Chart of Accounts Mapping Rules Report
Provides both the segment and account rules defined for a specific chart of accounts mapping. For mappings with account rules, prints each subsidiary account range and the parent account into which it maps. For mapping with segment rules, prints the rule name and the parent and subsidiary segments. For mappings with a rollup range rule, prints each subsidiary segment value range and its corresponding parent segment value. To run the predefined reports, navigate to the Scheduled Processes work area and follow these steps:
1. Click Schedule New Process . 2. Search for the process name. 3. Specify the parameters. 4. Enter the process options and schedule. 5. Click Submit .
section_synopsis:
Here is a compact summary of the section title:

Account and financial data summarized by report. Includes detailed journal information.
indexed_synopsis:
Here is a dense summary of the paragraph:

The Balancing Segment Value Assignments Report assigns primary values to legal entities and ledgers, identifying errors and unassigned values. The Chart of Accounts Mapping Rules Report provides rules for segmenting accounts and mapping subsidiary ranges. Predefined reports can be run through the Scheduled Processes work area, following steps that include searching, specifying parameters, and scheduling submissions.
